## Description {#details}

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/option">Option</a> - Abstract representation for a single form of driver argument.

An <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/option">Option</a> class represents a form of option that the driver takes, for example how many arguments the option has and how they can be provided. Individual option instances store additional information about what group the option is a member of (if any), if the option is an alias, and a number of flags. At runtime the driver parses the command line into concrete <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arg">Arg</a> instances, each of which corresponds to a particular <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/option">Option</a> instance.

Definition at line 54 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/option-h">Option.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### accept() {#ad51076ec38d35888db2929e6df4c72b8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::unique&#95;ptr&lt; Arg &gt; Option::accept (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arglist">ArgList</a> &amp; Args, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> CurArg, bool GroupedShortOption, unsigned &amp; Index) const</>}>
Potentially accept the current argument, returning a new <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/arg">Arg</a> instance, or 0 if the option does not accept this argument (or the argument is missing values).

If the option accepts the current argument, <a href="#ad51076ec38d35888db2929e6df4c72b8">accept()</a> sets Index to the position where argument parsing should resume (even if the argument is missing values).

<code>CurArg</code> The argument to be matched. It may be shorter than the underlying storage to represent a Joined argument. <code>GroupedShortOption</code> If true, we are handling the fallback case of parsing a prefix of the current argument as a short option.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/option-h/#l00230">230</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/option/option-h">Option.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#l00236">236</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp">Option.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getPrefixedName() {#a90afd0b4b229eea67299a6310c9a3f7f}

  prototype="StringRef llvm::opt::Option::getPrefixedName () const"

### matches() {#a34443bb51a0b61e6c113e721533d3235}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool Option::matches (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/opt/optspecifier">OptSpecifier</a> ID) const</>}>
matches - <a href="/docs/api/classes/predicate">Predicate</a> for whether this option is part of the given option (which may be a group).

Note that matches against options which are an alias should never be done â€“ aliases do not participate in matching and so such a query will always be false.
